Detailed Description

This class contains the implementation of Obex related operations (Connect, Put, Get, ...) for both Client and Server connections.

The public section implements the interfaces, while the private section implements structures and methods to perform the Obex operations through the Obex Services (see the related document, xxxxxx put reference here ). The Obex Services are a wrapper to the BtObexController which works in conjunction with the Mecel stack).

Member Function Documentation

void BtObexImpl::Abort (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  abort_req
)  [virtual]
 

Aborts an ongoing OBEX client operation.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier of the operation to be aborted
abort_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the ABORT request

Implements ObexLayer.

ObexResult BtObexImpl::AcquireClientChannel (  ObexChannel &  result,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr,
BOOLEAN  reserve = FALSE
)  [virtual]
 

Allocates an Obex Channel for the client.

Parameters:
result The allocated obex channel reference if no errors occured
addr_ptr Smartpointer holding a valid transport address, can be ignored for Bt Obex implementation (IrDA related only)
reserve If set to TRUE, indicates that private transport resources should be reserved for this channel. The Bt Obex implementation ignore this parameter. It is present for interface compatibility only, but is always FALSE.
Returns:
TRUE in case of success, ObexResult indicating an error if the channel pool is full
Note: this function does not call the stack, is a factory function.

Implements ObexProtocol.

ObexResult BtObexImpl::AcquireServerChannel (  ObexChannel &  result,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr,
BOOLEAN  reserve = FALSE
)  [virtual]
 

Allocates an Obex Channel for the server, no stack calling.

Parameters:
result The allocated obex channel reference if no errors occured
addr_ptr Smartpointer holding a valid transport address, can be ignored for Bt Obex implementation (IrDA related only)
reserve If set to TRUE, indicates that private transport resources should be reserved for this channel. The Bt Obex implementation ignore this parameter. It is present for interface compatibility only, but is always FALSE.
Returns:
TRUE in case of success, ObexResult indicating an error if the channel pool is full
Note: this function does not call the stack, is a factory function.

Implements ObexProtocol.

void BtObexImpl::BindServerChannel (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr
)  [virtual]
 

Registers to the stack like server. Takes a rfcomm port number from the stack, associates it to the Obex Address and Channel, registers the server like service in the SDDB.

Parameters:
server_chan Server transport channel to open (bind).
oper_id Operation identifier
addr_ptr Smartpointer holding the OBEX address of the service to be bounded
Note: this function is the first stack calling while establishing a Server Obex session

Implements ObexProtocol.

void BtObexImpl::CloseChannel (  const ObexChannel &  channel,
ObexOperationId  oper_id
)  [virtual]
 

Closes an Obex Channel.

Parameters:
channel Channel to be closed.
oper_id Operation identifier
The channel must have been previously opened with an OpenClientChannel() (or a BindServerChannel()?)

Implements ObexProtocol.

void BtObexImpl::Connect (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  conn_req
)  [virtual]
 

Starts an Obex connection to the remote server.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
conn_req Obex Object which holds the headers to be included in the CONNECT request and flags according to OBEX Spec. 3.3.1.2, but no data !
Note: in the passed Obex Object there are headers only, no Obex Buffer allocated

Implements ObexLayer.

void BtObexImpl::DataProcessed (  const ObexChannel &  channel,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
ObexBuffer &  obex_buffer
)  [virtual]
 

Confirm processing of data delivered to an application.

Parameters:
channel Channel associated with the requested operation
oper_id Operation identifier
obex_buffer Buffer to be disposed
By calling this method the application layer returns the ownership of a buffer back to the protocol implementation which had produced the buffer and therefore knows how to dispose it.

Implements ObexLayer.

void BtObexImpl::Disconnect (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  disc_req
)  [virtual]
 

Starts an Obex DISCONNECT operation.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
disc_req Obex Object which holds the headers to be included in the DISCONNECT request.
Note: in the passed Obex Objext there are headers only, no Obex Buffer allocated

Implements ObexLayer.

void BtObexImpl::Get (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  get_req
)  [virtual]
 

Starts or continues an Obex GET operation.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier.
get_req Obex Object which holds the headers to be included in the GET request and possibly BODY data within an ObexBuffer.
Note that in rare cases a GET request may contain a BODY header !

Implements ObexLayer.

Mutex* BtObexImpl::GetTransportMutex (   )  [inline]
 

void BtObexImpl::OpenClientChannel (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr
)  [virtual]
 

Associates an Obex Channel to an Obex Address.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel under association.
oper_id Operation identifier
addr_ptr Smartpointer holding the Obex Address under association (of the service to connect to)
Note: this function is the first stack calling while establishing a Client Obex session

Implements ObexProtocol.

void BtObexImpl::Put (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  put_req
)  [virtual]
 

Starts or continues an Obex PUT operation.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
put_req Obex Object which holds the headers to be included in the PUT request and BODY data within an ObexBuffer.

Implements ObexLayer.

ObexResult BtObexImpl::ReleaseChannel (  ObexChannel &  channel  )  [virtual]
 

Releases an Obex Channel.

Returns:
TRUE in case of success, ObexResult indicating an error otherwise.
The channel must have been previously obtained by calling the AcquireClientChannel() or the AcquireServerChannel()

Implements ObexProtocol.

void BtObexImpl::ReturnResponse (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  server_resp
)  [virtual]
 

By calling this method the Server (application layer) sends a response to a remote client request.

Parameters:
server_chan Server channel associated with the response.
oper_id Operation identifier
server_resp OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the response, the response code and possibly BODY data within an ObexBuffer.

Implements ObexLayer.

void BtObexImpl::SetPath (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  setp_req
)  [virtual]
 

Starts an Obex SETHPATH operation.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
setp_req Obex Object which holds the headers to be included in the SETPATH request and flags according to OBEX Spec. 3.3.6.1, but no data !
Note: in the passed Obex Object there are headers only, no Obex Buffer allocated

Implements ObexLayer.
